content: mollie mae verily knits mollie mae is a quick and simple hat knit in the round from the bottom up for an alternative look you could knit the waves in different colours materials gauge aran weight yarn shown in cascade 220 16sts x 20 row = 4 / 10cm superwash aran main colour 80 yds / 73m finished measurements contrast colour 40yds / 37m 3 75mm / us5 16 circular needle 4 5mm / us7 16 circular needle plus dpns to fit average sized womans head with 20 - 22 4 stitch markers circumference 51 - 56cm protected under uk copyright 2016 all rights reserved pattern for personal use only contact enquiries@verilyknits co uk 1 abbreviations pm place marker k knit mc main colour p purl cc contrast colour sts stitches k2tog knit 2sts together round round repeat repeat instructions using smaller needles and cc cast on 80sts pm and join to work in the round being careful not to twist ribbing round *k1 p1 repeat from * to end repeat ribbing round until work measures 1 / 2 5cm or desired length for ribbing change to larger needles and knit 3 rnds join mc and work rnds 1 - 9 of colourwork chart chart is repeated 8 times each round 9 8 7 6 5 4 3 2 1 k1 in mc k1 in cc protected under uk copyright 2016 all rights reserved pattern for personal use only contact enquiries@verilyknits co uk 2 break cc and continuing in mc knit every round until work measures 5 5 / 14cm next round *k20 pm repeat from * to end crown decreases decrease round *k to 2sts before m k2tog repeat from * to end repeat decrease round until 8sts remain break yarn thread through remaining sts pull tight and secure finishing weave in all ends soak thoroughly and block lightly a balloon makes a great blocking form for this shape of hat protected under uk copyright 2016 all rights reserved pattern for personal use only contact enquiries@verilyknits co uk
